fontTheory.description: The typography system aims to balance professionalism with readability. Using classic serif and sans-serif fonts enhances the document's formal tone while ensuring easy legibility.
fontTheory.readability: The serif body text improves readability for long passages, while the sans-serif headings and titles provide contrast and hierarchy.
fontTheory.hierarchy: Clear hierarchy is achieved through font sizes, weights, and styles. Headings are bold and larger, while body text is regular and slightly smaller.
fontTheory.fontPairings: The pairing of Georgia and Arial creates a harmonious balance between traditional elegance and modern clarity. The monospace font Courier New is chosen for code blocks to ensure clear distinction and readability.
